articles.author: Raphael Satter
articles.description: A hacker is advertising millions of "pieces of data" stolen from the family genetics websites 23andMe, according to posts made to an online forum where digital thieves often advertise leaked data.
articles.title: Hackers advertise sale of 23andMe data on leaked data forum

articles.author: Diane Bartz, David French
articles.description: The White House may have blamed Exxon Mobil (XOM.N) for high energy prices taking their toll on consumers, but would struggle to thwart the top U.S. oil producer's contemplated $60 billion acquisition of Pioneer Natural Resources (PXD.N), five antitrust lawyers and experts said on Friday.
articles.title: Analysis: US would struggle to block Exxon's politically unpopular megadeal

articles.author: Joseph White, David Shepardson
articles.description: The United Auto Workers held off on additional strikes against Detroit Three auto plants on Friday, citing General Motors' (GM.N) unexpected willingness to allow workers at joint-venture battery plants to be covered by union contracts.
articles.title: UAW says its 'strike is working,' holds off on more walkouts

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: India has sent notices to social media platforms X, formerly known as Twitter, YouTube (GOOGL.O) and Telegram asking them to ensure there is no child sexual abuse material on their platforms, the government said on Friday.
articles.title: India tells X, YouTube, Telegram to remove any child sexual abuse material

articles.author: Lewis Krauskopf
articles.description: Soaring Treasury yields have stunned the U.S. equity market in recent weeks, with some of the worst fallout hitting a group of stocks expected to have bond-like qualities.
articles.title: Wall St Week Ahead Surging Treasury yields upend stock market's "bond proxies"

articles.author: Sinead Cruise, Iain Withers
articles.description: Debt-laden companies across Europe, Middle East and Africa face a $500 billion refinancing scramble in the first half of 2024, a challenge that could kill off many "zombie" businesses even though an expected peak in rates could bring some relief.
articles.title: Fall of the zombies? Why corporate failures could surge in 2024

articles.author: Jody Godoy, Luc Cohen
articles.description: In testimony that could prove damning for Bankman-Fried's defense, Gary Wang said his boss was aware of an $8 billion shortfall in customer assets on Nov. 7, 2022, when he tweeted in the face of a surge of customer withdrawals, "FTX is fine. Assets are fine."
articles.title: Sam Bankman-Fried directed special FTX privileges for Alameda -testimony

articles.author: Lucia Mutikani
articles.description: U.S. job growth surged in September, suggesting that the labor market remains strong enough for the Federal Reserve to raise interest rates this year, though wage growth is moderating.
articles.title: US job growth beats expectations in September; unemployment rate unchanged at 3.8%

articles.author: Max Hunder
articles.description: In a burial plot next to a field outside the remote Ukrainian hamlet of Hroza, residents removed undergrowth and cleared away litter to make space for more graves.
articles.title: 'Half the village is gone': Ukraine hamlet reels after missile strike

articles.author: David Morgan
articles.description: Forty-five allies of former U.S. House Speaker Kevin McCarthy are calling on their Republican colleagues for "fundamental changes" that would make it more difficult for a small faction to oust whoever may take his place.
articles.title: 45 U.S. House Republicans seek to prevent another speaker ouster
